docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 4 -- The United States and Britain today opposed the enlargement of the proposed international committee to study the effects of atomic radiation.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 4 -- The United States and Britain today opposed the enlargement of the proposed international committee to study the effects of atomic radiation.

headline.main: U. N. SPLIT ON SIZE OF RADIATION UNIT; U. S., Britain Oppose Move to Enlarge Study Group -- Soviet Backs Peiping Role

headline.main: The Proceedings In the U. N.

docs.snippet: THERE has been an overturn in the nomenclature department in Argentina since Peron was thrown out. Not long after that an Argentine ship reached London and went into drydock. "Before you do anything else," the captain earnestly told the shipwrights,...
docs.lead_paragraph: THERE has been an overturn in the nomenclature department in Argentina since Peron was thrown out. Not long after that an Argentine ship reached London and went into drydock. "Before you do anything else," the captain earnestly told the shipwrights, "take off that name and put on a new one."
docs.abstract: A Taylor article on bizarre US place names urges their retention; cartoon

headline.main: Communique From the C.A.P.N.; A member of the Connoisseurs of American Place Names warns that changes in our native nomenclature can go too far.
U.N. AWAITS PRESIDENTS; Executives of Uruguay and Costa Rica to Pay Visits

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: PANAMA, Nov. 6 -- Juan D. Peron said here today that the revolt that ousted him as President of Argentina had been financed in Montevideo, Uruguay, by the old Argentine "oligarchy."
docs.lead_paragraph: PANAMA, Nov. 6 -- Juan D. Peron said here today that the revolt that ousted him as President of Argentina had been financed in Montevideo, Uruguay, by the old Argentine "oligarchy."
docs.abstract: Peron arrives, Panama; charges old Argentine 'oligarchy' financed his overthrow from Montevideo; bars running again for Pres; denies he amassed riches during regime; defers decision on permanent exile; bars US visit; says Nicaragua visit was spurred by Somoza message after revolt

headline.main: OLD 'OLIGARCHY' BLAMED BY PERON; Former Dictator, in Panama, Declares the Revolt Was Financed in Uruguay

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: A strong undertone for the British pound sterling and a sharp turn to the easier side for the Canadian dollar marked the trading in the foreio'n exchange market during the last Week. Turnover of business picked up considerably over what had prevaiIed...
docs.lead_paragraph: A strong undertone for the British pound sterling and a sharp turn to the easier side for the Canadian dollar marked the trading in the foreio'n exchange market during the last Week. Turnover of business picked up considerably over what had prevaiIed in the previous weeks.

headline.main: Foreign Exchange Rates; Week Ended Nov. 4, 1955

docs.snippet: CLEVELAND, Nov. 7 -- Three thousand members of the United Church Women were present as the seventh national assembly began today.
